definitions.definition: involving large numbers of people who work together to do something in a way that has been carefully planned

examples.text: He was part of an organized criminal gang.
39% of male respondents stated that they regularly participated in organized sport compared with 17% of female respondents.

definitions.definition: arranged or planned well or in the way mentioned

examples.text: Although it doesn't look like it, the whole thing is highly organized.
a loosely organized confederacy of allies
Approach the interview in an organized way.

definitions.definition: able to plan your work, life, etc. well and in an efficient way

examples.text: Isn't it time you started to get organized?
The new secretary was organized and conscientious.
The chairman is one of the most organized people I know.
A highly organized man, he rarely dropped in just for a chat.
